intro: Pholidota yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan pholidota, is a rare species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its unique, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is typically found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
